pullrequest.title: Feature System Part 7: Features for programmatic construction of objects

content.raw:
Currently it makes no difference at all. I created the the `Feature::Link` class \(and other `Feature::X` classes\) because I thought we might need to have some member functions that universal for all classes derived from `Feature::X` \(for example, the `InitiateEngine(~)` function of `Feature::Implementation`\), but so far `Feature::Implementation` is the only class for which that has been necessary.

For the sake of consistency, I'll change `Entity` to `Link` here. In the future, we can reevaluate what kind of inheritance pattern is preferable.
content.html:
Currently it makes no difference at all. I created the the Feature::Link class (and other Feature::X classes) because I thought we might need to have some member functions that universal for all classes derived from Feature::X (for example, the InitiateEngine(~) function of Feature::Implementation), but so far Feature::Implementation is the only class for which that has been necessary.

For the sake of consistency, I'll change Entity to Link here. In the future, we can reevaluate what kind of inheritance pattern is preferable.
